! subroutine to sort an array in descending order

subroutine sort_desc(arr)

  integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

  integer :: i, j, temp, n

  n = size(arr) do i = 1, n-1
     do j = i+1, n
        if (arr(i) < arr(j)) then
           temp = arr(i)
           arr(i) = arr(j)
           arr(j) = temp
        end if
     end do
  end do
end subroutine sort_desc

end program codeforces_462_B

! subroutine to sort an array in descending order

subroutine sort_desc(arr)

  integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

  integer :: i, j, temp, n

  n = size(arr)

  do i = 1, n-1
     do j = i+1, n
        if (arr(i) < arr(j)) then
           temp = arr(i)
           arr(i) = arr(j)
           arr(j) = temp
        end if
     end do
  end do
end subroutine sort_desc

end program codeforces_462_B

So the full code would be:

program CodeForce462B
  implicit none
  integer, dimension(26) :: counts
  integer :: n, k, remaining, change, sumcounts
  character(len=:), allocatable :: s
  integer :: i, pos
  integer :: ans =0

  read*, n, k
  allocate( character(n) :: s )
  read(*,*) s
  counts = 0

  do i=1,n
    pos = ichar(s(i:i)) - ichar('A') +1
    counts(pos) = counts(pos)+1
  end do

  sumcounts = sum( counts )
  remaining = min( k, sumcounts )

  do while ( remaining >0 )
    call sort_desc(counts)
    change = min( counts(1), remaining )
    ans = ans + change * change
    counts(1) = counts(1) - change
    remaining = remaining - change
  end do

  print*, ans

  deallocate(s)
contains

  subroutine sort_desc(arr)
    integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)
    integer :: i, j, temp, n
    n = size(arr)

    do i=1, n-1
      do j=i+1, n
        if (arr(i) < arr(j)) then
          temp = arr(i)
          arr(i) = arr(j)
          arr(j) = temp
        end if
      end do
    end do
  end subroutine sort_desc

end program CodeForce462B
